etymologies: late 15th century (denoting a person who kills their brother or sister, derived from Latin fratricida): the primary current sense comes via French from late Latin fratricidium, from frater ‘brother’ + -cidium (see -cide)

definitions: the killing of one's brother or sister

examples.text: Cain justifies his fratricide with lethal logic

shortDefinitions: killing of one's brother or sister

definitions: a person who kills their brother or sister.
shortDefinitions: person who kills their brother or sister

definitions: the accidental killing of one's own forces in war

examples.text: the Vietnam War saw fratricide increase because of the close-in jungle fighting

shortDefinitions: accidental killing of one's own forces in war
